summary: H.R. 332, the “Travel Trailer and Camper Tax Parity Act,” proposes an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The bill seeks to expand the definition of “floor plan financing” to include financing for travel trailers and campers designed for temporary recreational, camping, or seasonal use. This change would allow businesses that sell these vehicles to fully deduct their interest expenses, providing them with the same tax treatment as motor vehicle dealerships. The amendment is intended to apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
